bug.author: NickYi1990
bug.summary: Data have rejected variables, but do not display in Warnings
bug.description:
Data have rejected variables, but do not display in Warnings from pandas_profiling import ProfileReport profile = ProfileReport(pd.DataFrame({"a": [1,1,1,1,1,1]}), minimal=True) <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13381684/75269098-56240900-5833-11ea-8774-b588d3ec874c.png></denchmark-link>
2.5.0

comments.comment: Thank you for reporting this. We invite interested contributors to create a pull request with this functionality. More details can be found in the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md>contribution guide</denchmark-link> .

I noticed that four types of warning messages(Uniform,Unique,Rejected,Constant) are ignored when rendering. Since Rejected is always comes with other warnings, is it necessary to add all types of warnings above? or it will end up like this: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33747091/79096552-19cf4c80-7d90-11ea-9693-068790bab0c2.png></denchmark-link>
v2.7.0 changes the behavior to report all warnings, except "rejected", as that would be redundant.
